``` ::: :::: ::::: The visual and aesthetic difference between markdown and HTML is glaringly obvious. HTML is also meant to be a text editor and not a programming language, while markdown combines text-based editing with programming languages^[Rmarkdown's knitr can execute code in Python, SQL, Bash, Stan, JS, CSS just to name a few languages]. ## Enter Pollen Pollen is a publishing system built on top of Scribble and [Racket](https://racket-lang.org/)^[Racket is a programming language based on Lisp]. This markup language is typically used to create digital books, PDFs and other types of files as its output.
